alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 20 at 2:49PM EDT until June 21 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Statement, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the Beach Hazards Statement, Breaking waves of 6 to 7 feet and onshore swell will result in rough surf conditions and a high risk of rip currents. * WHERE...Virginia Beach. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Statement, from 10 PM EDT this evening through late tonight. For the Beach Hazards Statement, from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Shallow flooding is possible in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 21/12 AM 4.7 1.9 2.0 2 MINOR 21/12 PM 4.5 1.7 2.3 2 MINOR 22/12 AM 4.3 1.5 1.7 1-2 NONE 22/01 PM 3.5 0.7 1.3 1 NONE 23/01 AM 3.5 0.7 1.1 1 NONE CHESAPEAKE BAY BRIDGE TUNNEL VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.0 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.1 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 20/11 PM 4.5 1.6 1.6 4-5 NONE 21/11 AM 4.2 1.3 1.9 5-6 NONE 21/11 PM 4.3 1.4 1.6 5 NONE 22/11 AM 3.3 0.4 1.1 2 NONE 23/12 AM 3.6 0.7 1.0 2 NONE LYNNHAVEN INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 5.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 20/11 PM 4.4 1.7 2.0 1 NONE 21/11 AM 4.2 1.5 2.3 1 NONE 22/12 AM 4.1 1.4 1.7 1 NONE 22/12 PM 3.2 0.5 1.3 1 NONE 23/12 AM 3.3 0.6 1.1 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways. Life-threatening rip currents. If caught in a rip current, remain calm. Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If tired, float or tread water until out of the rip current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help. Shore break occurs when waves break directly on the beach. It is extremely important to protect your head and neck whenever you are in breaking waves by keeping your hands in front of you at all times.
